ygData.msgSnippet: Now im not sure what level your SK, but after 40 levels, i am willing to stretch my neck out and say that i have no problem with what they did. Even before
ygData.messageBody:
Now im not sure what level your SK, but after 40
levels, i am willing to stretch my neck out and say
that i have no problem with what they did.
Even before they gave us the tap series, it was pretty
much predicted that they werent going to be a huge
factor in our arsenal. But rather a nice little side
addition. Keep in mind what they replaced.
the life taps arent meant to fill you up with only a
few castings. At level 40, 89 INT (im a human after
all) it takes a full bub of mana to cast lifedraw.So i
can cast it 5 times.
Thats 225 HP i dont have to sit on my butt and wait
for. Mana comes back a heck of a lot quicker than HP
thats for sure.
Its either that or you can sit around and talk thru
your pet while you wait for those 225 to regen.

Your point on HT is still an issue that we should
indeed fight for.
Especially since they added in the 2/3 DMG with PvP.
So not only was our HT very resistable to begin with,
now they chopped it down even more.
So instead of doing 401, at best, i can do only 266,
and thats if its not resisted at all.
I am still a strong supported to have a Tap feature
added to the HT.
Now fighting any form of healer (esp Pallies) with our
weakened "special ability" has been made even more
difficult. Does that mean we will lose all the time?
of course not. But still we have our already shaky HT
made even weaker. Weakening an already weak
"attribute" doesnt sound like balancing to me.
So instead of making it unresistable, instead of
boosting the DMG, just add a Tap.
So when it does that awesome 14DMG, you can at least
heal up that same 14.
example:
40 SK vs 40 Pal, equal equipment , all that stuff
SK-HT=266
Pal-LoH=801
266=801 ? ummm..dont think so. But then again i am a
product of the public school system.

Add the Tap feature:
SK-HT=266, 266 tapped= 532
Pal-LoH=801
532=801 ? Still nope..but its a hell of alot better
than the first example.

Anyway...thats my opinion of course

Stab a Light Bringer in the eye
